entry.title: Biggest Movers: MATIC Bounces From 4-Week Low, After Collision With Key Support Point
entry.summary:
Polygon rebounded from a four-week low on Wednesday, as bulls rejected a breakout below a key support point. The wider market cap was mostly higher in today‚Äôs session, led by the optimism surrounding Microstrategy‚Äôs latest bitcoin investment. Chainlink also jumped higher after recent losses.
Polygon (MATIC)
Polygon (MATIC) bounced back higher during Wednesday‚Äôs session, as the token moved away from a recent four-week low.
After plunging to a bottom $0.6751 on Tuesday, MATIC/USD rallied to a peak of $0.7022 earlier in the day.
The move came as bulls rejected a breakout below a recent price floor of $0.6750, which coincided with the relative strength index (RSI) pushing away from its own support level.
After racing from the aforementioned point at 43.00, the index made an attempt to reach resistance of 45.00.
However, at the time of writing, price strength is now tracking at a reading of 44.06, with MATIC back below $0.7000.
Overall, momentum appears to be bearish, with the token falling for five of the last seven sessions.
Chainlink (LINK)
In addition to polygon, chainlink (LINK) rebounded from a recent losing streak which resulted in price hitting a one-week low.
LINK/USD leaped to an intraday high of $7.70 during today‚Äôs session, following a drop to a low of $7.40 the day prior.
Yesterday‚Äôs decline pushed chainlink below a support point of $7.50, and to its weakest level since July 26.
LINK has managed to recover from its earlier drop, as the RSI climbed away from its own floor at the 55.00 zone.
Currently, the index is tracking at 56.78, and appears to be making a move towards a ceiling of 60.00.
In the event that this level is hit, there is a good chance that LINK moves above $7.80.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could chainlink hit $8.00 by this time next week? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: KPMG Deems Bitcoin ‚ÄòMisunderstood‚Äô: Energy Consumption At Par With Tumble Dryers
entry.summary:
Prominent accounting and consultancy firm, KPMG, has published a report delving into Bitcoin and its mining implications. The report focuses on investigating Bitcoin‚Äôs potential to align with the principles of environmentally friendly investing, commonly known as ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance).
KPMG‚Äôs latest report categorizes Bitcoin (BTC) as a mature asset class, though it highlights the persistent misunderstandings despite its continued adoption.
The report‚Äôs primary objective is to thoroughly assess the technology‚Äôs actual environmental, social, and governance impacts and dispel prevailing misconceptions on these fronts.
Related Reading: Here‚Äôs What KPMG Said About Slowdown In Crypto Investments
In particular, they state that there is a variety of high-impact use c‚Ä¶

entry.title: What Is A Bitcoin ETF?
entry.summary: Introduction As interest in bitcoin continues to grow, so does the demand for investment products that provide exposure to companies and funds alike. One such product that has gained significant attention is the Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF). What Is An ETF? ETFs are designed to track the performance of a particular index, commodity or asset class. This means that when you invest in an ETF, you are essentially buying a basket of securities or commodities that represent the underlying index or asset. For example, if you invest in an ETF that tracks the S&P 500 index, you will own a proportional share of the companies included in that index. One of the key advantages of ETFs is their ability to be traded on a stock exchange throughout the day, just like individual stocks. This is in con‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripples Returns 80% Of Unlocked XRP For August Back To Escrow
entry.summary:
Popular blockchain technology company, Ripple, has recently announced it was returning 800 million XRP tokens to its escrow wallet just after unlocking 1 billion tokens for this month. News of the event was reported by the prominent blockchain analytics and tracking platform Whale Alert.¬†
Ripple‚Äôs Commitment To Preserve Its Ecosystem
In a series of tweets released earlier today, Whale Alert confirmed that the return comes after Ripple released 1 billion tokens for the month of August. According to the tracking and analytics company, 300 million XRP with a whooping value of $209 million were safely locked back in the Ripple Escrow wallet.¬†
Additionally, the Whale Alert also revealed that a further 500 million XRP tokens have also been locked back into escrow. The 500 million tokens,‚Ä¶

As part of the partnership, Marathon will hold the prominent title of Moon Sponsor each year, solidifying their support of our conference and continued active participant in the ecosystem.¬† Additionally, Marathon will serve as the Main Live Desk Sponsor in collaboration with Bitcoin Magazine, where a custom-made desk will be‚Ä¶

entry.title: Japanese Yen Hits 20-Year Low Against US Dollar; BOJ Maintains Loose Policy Amid Inflation Pressures
entry.summary:
In the last month, Japan‚Äôs official currency has dipped slightly more than 1% in comparison to the U.S. dollar. Then, on Tuesday, the Japanese yen plummeted to its weakest position against the greenback in over 20 years, a shift that came after the Bank of Japan opted to keep its extremely loose monetary policy unchanged, despite the mounting pressures of inflation and a depreciating currency.
Yen‚Äôs Steepest Dive in 20 Years as BOJ Stands Firm on Loose Monetary Strategy
The yen weakened past 143 to the dollar on Tuesday, down more than 5 yen from Friday when the Bank of Japan (BOJ) announced it would allow long-term yields to rise to 1% from 0.5%. The BOJ kept its key interest rate at -0.1% and said the 1% cap on 10-year bond yields was not a fixed target but a loose guideline.
Eco‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC ‚ÄòWeaponized‚Äô XRP Quarterly Reports in Lawsuit, Ripple Says
entry.summary:
Brad Garlinghouse, the Chief Executive Officer of Ripple Labs, a payment protocol and exchange network, has slammed the US Securities and Exchange Commission for allegedly using the company‚Äôs quarterly reports about its native cryptocurrency, XRP, in the agency‚Äôs case against the crypto firm. Garlinghouse stated this today (Wednesday) in a Twitter post, quoting the company‚Äôs XRP quarterly report for the second quarter (Q2) of this year. Ripple Criticizes SEC In the Twitter post, the Ripple CEO noted that the company initiated the reports to ‚Äúvoluntarily‚Äù provide updates about its XRP holdings. However, the securities allegedly used them against the firm during the lawsuit process.
We began these reports to voluntarily provide updates given our XRP holdings. Sadly, the‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.
